definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to be lenient/to relent/to be reluctant to make a hard decision/to think twice
flexible/not rigid/spongy/soft or runny (not set hard)/loose (soil)

sentences.english: A soft felt hat with a wide flexible brim .
sentences.chinese: 有一個靈活的寬邊的軟氈帽。

sentences.english: Pre-compression is the most common method for treating soft soil foundation.
sentences.chinese: 預壓是最常用的軟土地基處治方法。

sentences.english: Equipped with a soft starter, low-impact load at startup.
sentences.chinese: 配有軟啓動器，啓動時衝擊負荷低。

sentences.english: It was soft and slippery. It felt a little like velvet.
sentences.chinese: 海豚的鰭摸起來又軟又滑，感覺有點像天鵝絨。

sentences.english: Homes, for small minor quick fix on most soft plastics.
sentences.chinese: 用於居家，爲小較小快速修復在多數軟的塑料。

sentences.english: Of, relating to, or characteristic of a hydroid.

sentences.english: Of all kinds of shawls, Shahtoosh is the most expensive with light and soft quality.

sentences.english: The ear leather is thick, covered with soft short hair, and when measured, should reach the inner corner of the eye.
sentences.chinese: 耳皮豐厚，被軟短毛，如測量應可達眼睛內側角。

sentences.english: The waist buttocks use the flexible connection, in raises in the process the patient not easy to glide down.
sentences.chinese: 腰臀部採用軟連接，在升起的過程中病人不易下滑。

sentences.english: Merkel is as soft as chewed bubble gum. Pathetic woman.
sentences.chinese: 默克爾就像嚼過的泡泡糖一樣軟，可憐的女人。

sentences.english: Nonmetals are generally gases or soft solids that do not conduct electricity.
sentences.chinese: 非金屬一般爲氣體或不導電的軟固體。

sentences.english: Touching something soft, I sprang quickly back.
sentences.chinese: 摸到一種軟呼呼的東西，我一下子蹦了回來。

sentences.english: Use a big, soft, black brush to paint on the layer mask.
sentences.chinese: 使用大，軟，黑油漆刷上的圖層蒙版。

sentences.english: Snows are usually soft. And so was his handling when started.
sentences.chinese: 雪正常來說應該是軟棉棉的，很易可以掃走。

sentences.english: The drain should be soft and pliable .
sentences.chinese: 引流物應是軟而易彎的。

sentences.english: After the soft breakdown, the leakage current at the low electric field increases irregularly.
sentences.chinese: 軟擊穿後柵介質低場漏電流無規則增大。

definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
